tool.name: SaveGeodatabase
tool.displayname: Back up simple Geodatabase as XML

param.name: Input_Geodatabase
param.dialogReference: Select a file geodatabase. If the geodatabase has domains, subtypes, attribute rules, etc applied to it, then this is not the proper tool. Use other tools in the Data Management tool box like Copy Features.
param.pythonReference: Select a file geodatabase. If the geodatabase has domains, subtypes, attribute rules, etc applied to it, then this is not the proper tool. Use other tools in the Data Management tool box like Copy Features.

param.name: Output_XML_Workspace_Location
param.dialogReference: Select the output location for the XML file.
param.pythonReference: Select the output location for the XML file.

param.name: Output_XML_Workspace_Name
param.dialogReference: Provide a name for the XML file. This XML file will contain both the data and schema for the feature classes and tables from the input geodatabase.
param.pythonReference: Provide a name for the XML file. This XML file will contain both the data and schema for the feature classes and tables from the input geodatabase.

tool.summary: This tool backs up a geodatabase as an XML file. This is meant for simple geodatabases. Ones that do not have domains, subtypes, attribute rules, etc.
tool.usage: Created by Timothy Kinlaw in Esri Training Services.

idCitation.resTitle: Back up simple Geodatabase as XML

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by Timothy Kinlaw in Esri Training Services.
